- Offshore wind sector progress and ownership changes

## 2) Top Stories
- Finnish police have seized a ship and detained a Russian crew over alleged subsea cable cutting, indicating a security threat to critical infrastructure (Source: datacenterdynamics.com).  
- China continues to lead in offshore wind single-unit turbine capacity in 2025, with Vestas installing its 15 MW turbine at offshore wind farms (Source: offshorewind.biz).  
- Apollo has become a co-owner of the Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm, marking significant investment activity in offshore wind assets (Source: offshorewind.biz).  
- The UK solar market is poised for record Contract for Difference (CfD) deployment in 2026, signaling strong support for solar expansion (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- US solar market expected to reach nearly 738 GW by 2035, highlighting rapid solar capacity growth forecasts (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- China solar wafer manufacturers have raised quotes, with module prices for 2026 potentially hitting CNY 1/W, impacting global PV supply chains (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- New digital twin technology for floating photovoltaic applications incorporates artificial intelligence, merging AI with renewable asset management (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- A US state has ordered a utility to enable flexible grid connections for community solar projects, reinforcing grid modernization and expansion of distributed renewables (Source: pv-magazine.com).
